list_definition.definition: (often night-watchman) a man employed to guard a building etc against thieves, especially at night

list_ex_of_english: Will the spy and the watchman ever meet?
This is an entrance gate watchman's shelter hut at the commencement of an avenue of trees, with shrubberies on three sides of it.
We were mere watchmen; we have become real builders.
These included the everyday needs of a new administrative office such as hiring night watchmen and providing money for tea and other minor necessities.
It occurs to one that one is a night watchman, and then one wonders what his function is.
An unrestrained, environmentally unsound materialism, and imbalanced development prevailed, not 'night watchman' rule.
No. 11 station is a watchman's room at the end of a building used as a printing office.
Headmen harboured them; village watchmen shared their illegal spoil.
